answers.text:
Hi Pam, 
While ICMA's Knowledge Network does not currently have an example commonsense ordinance there are two articles that mention ways that local governments can encourage employee risk taking. 
Council Relations is an article from PM Magazine- http://webapps.icma.org/pm/9305/public/council.cfm?title=Council%20Relations&subtitle=&author=
Tidbits from Local Government Innovators-http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/blogs/blog/45/Tidbits_from_Local_Government_Innovators
I hope your member and others looking to encourage risk taking in 2014 find these useful. 
Best,
Robin Saywitz 
ICMA Knowledge Network Intern 
rsaywitz@icma.org

author: Pamela Muse
text:
An Alliance member is looking for information/examples of the "development of a potential ordinance to encourage risk-taking within the organization, by providing “protection” to staff that demonstrate innovation or just good judgment in areas that are not explicitly authorized; known as commonsense ordinance.
Appreciate any help you can provide!
Pamela Muse
West Regional Director
Alliance for Innovation
888-468-6450 Office
480-231-3538 Text
pmuse@transformgov.org
www.transformgov.org
www.tlgconference.org
title: Commonsense Ordinance
